critique: The document pertains to the transfer of control of air navigation facilities from military to civilian (Department of Commerce) hands, particularly those located outside the US. It seems to be an administrative action to facilitate international air travel post-WWII. There's a slight expansion of executive power as it's an executive order, but it's within the scope of wartime powers and doesn't drastically alter the balance. It has a slight federalism tilt as it centralizes control in the Department of Commerce.
